page.title: 09Farming in Lawshall District
page.content: Of our area, 83% is farmland,the major- ity of which is arable-growing wheat, barley,oil seed rape, field beans,oats, hay and grass for silage. There is also a small pig farm,another 2 with small friesian dairy herds and another 2 with suffolk sheep. The farms tend to be small and are therefore lacking in much expensive equipment, so there is an amount of sharing or hiring from each other. With the recent changes in the stubble burning laws, after last year's harvest, there was hardly a field burnt off, which pleased conservationists among us. In recent years, many hedge- rows have been ripped out to make larger fields and use of every scrap of land. One effect of this is during bad winters, such as the last one, we get very large snow drifts causing the roads to be blocked.Also many Public Footpaths and Bridleways have been lost
